result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Atty Peter Rotter
Review hearing on November 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Case Called: 10:53 am
INCLUDES 21CF1059, 21CF1649, 22CF736.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher in person. Defendant appears in custody, in person, pro se.
VRCW.
Date and time set to address the Defendant's Motion for Bond Modification.
Defendant makes arguments. 
State objects to any bond modification and makes arguments. 
J.K.F. makes statement. 
Court addresses the Defendant.
COURT ORDERS:
Court Denies the Defendant's Bond Motion.

SPD Office is still actively looking for counsel for the Defendant.
Court extends the time limits for the holding of the preliminary hearing until the next in court hearing- 11/17/2022.

VRCW.

Atty Yanke makes statements regarding attempting to find counsel for the Defendant.
Court addresses the Defendant. Court notes that the Defendant has been in custody for quite a while.
Court to reschedule this matter for one more review hearing. SPD office to continue to search for counsel for the Defendant.
Court Extends time limits for the holding of the Preliminary Hearing.

Case Called: 1:51 pm
INCLUDES 21CF1059, 21CF1649, 22CF736.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Sid Brubacher in person. Defendant appears in custody, via Zoom Video, and with Atty Richard Bender via Zoom Video.
VRCW.
Date and time set to address the Defendant's counsel status. 
Parties make statements; 
Atty Bender states that he is willing to remain on the older cases until a new Attorney is appointed on all files, including the ones that he is appointed on. 
Defendant makes statements. 
Defendant states that she has an SAR on 08/09/2022 that she wishes that Atty Bender stay on- Atty Bender states that he will handle this if a new Attorney is not appointed yet on 20CM187, which is a file not heard before this Court. 
Court notes that the SPD Office has reached out and made many contacts in regards to these files. 
Court addresses the parties. SPD Office to continue to try to get counsel appointed on all the files. 
Court notes that the Defendant still needs to have a Preliminary Hearing.
Court Finds Good Cause to Extend Time Limits. 
COURT to schedule a future hearing.

Date and time set for initial appearance in 22CF736 and 21CF1649;  VRCW.

Victim, J.F. makes statement.  

BOND:  $250,000.00 cash bond.  

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with the Estate of J.J.M. or representatives of the Estate of J.J.M. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  
- Prints and photographs.  
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
